metadata.Title: CVE-2015-9284 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: The request phase of the OmniAuth Ruby gem (1.9.1 and earlier) is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery when used as part of the Ruby on Rails framework, allowing accounts to be connected without user intent, user interaction, or feedback to the user. This permits a secondary account to be able to sign into the web application as the primary account.

criterions.comment: ruby-omniauth: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
